boardgame.name: Harbor
Harbour
El Puerto
ボードゲーム ハーバー
boardgame.description: Dockmaster Schlibble and Constable O'Brady cordially invite you to visit their bustling Harbour town! Attend to business at the Trader's Guild or the Masoner's Hall. Break for lunch at the Sushi Shop, or stop off for a drink at the Pub. Don't forget to check out the Wizard's Traveling Imaginarium before you go! But no matter where you go, keep on the lookout for a bargain... the denizens of this town are always wheeling and dealing! Collect and trade resources as you visit the various buildings of Harbour, and cash them in to buy your way into the town. Whoever has the most points worth of buildings when the game ends, wins!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Harbour is a worker placement game where players move their worker from building to building, collecting and trading Fish, Livestock, Wood, and Stone; and cashing those resources in to purchase buildings (which are the worker placement spots) from the central pool. Once a building is purchased, it is replaced from the deck, and the central pool is a small subset of the deck, and is therefore different every game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game ends when a player has purchased his fourth building. After that round finishes, the player with the most points worth of buildings is the winner!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;At the heart of Harbour is a dynamic market mechanism. Each time a player purchases a building, the value of the resources they used drops, while the value of the other resources rise. You'll have to carefully time your purchases to take advantage of the ebb and flow of market prices, or be prepared to waste some resources!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve overspent on Kickstarter... again! For sale is the my Kickstarter preorder for the first edition of Harbour. This is the early bird edition that comes with card sleeves included! Refer to the link below for all stretch goals unlocked in the campaign: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/michaelmindes/harbour-master-markets-in-a-fantasy-port?ref=email Buyer is responsible for Paypal fees, if any are incurred. PM me if concerned about avoiding fees through Paypal or similar service. Shipping to the US is FREE, given this is an unshipped Kickstarter. Expected delivery Jan or Feb 2015.

YOU ARE BUYING: [b]HARBOUR - KICKSTARTER EDITION BY SCOTT ALMES BRAND-NEW, SEALED BOX, IN-HAND AND READY TO SHIP - NOT A PRE-ORDER!!![/b] This Game Includes All Stretch Goals and Exclusives Including a New Belford Guild Promo Pack of Cards!!! [b][u]LIMITED LAUNCH EXCLUSIVE CHARACTERS and OTHER GREAT BONUS STUFF:[/u] • Fisherman - When you collect any fish, gain an additional fish. • Wholesailer - When buying a building, keep 1 of each good sold. • Noble - At the beginning of the game, look at the top 2 building cards and build 1 of them for no cost. It is worth $0 and 0 VP, and doesn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t count towards the 4 to trigger the game end. • Mason - When anybody uses stone to buy, collect 1 stone. • Speculator - At the end of the game, add VP to your total building worth equal to the current market value of stone. • Beggar - When another player gains goods from their character action, you gain 1 good of your choice. Custom Meeples!!! Belfort EXCLUSIVE Guild Promo Pack#1 Solo Player _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Training Dummy_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; Character Card and Rules UV Protection Film on Box Cover Bonus Buildings: • Floating Dock - gets you two fish, but if you have or are tied for the most anchors you get a fish and one of your choice. It has a Top Hat and a Warehouse connected to it! • Clocktower - pay one good and then on your next turn, double the action you perform. This can make for some big moves in the late game. I should note, however, there was a reason this was the last stretch goal—it brings with it a ton of rules and timing questions. For whom does the bell toll? It tolls for its own FAQ once the game is available. Victory Lap Care for the winner - special silly rules for the winner to do!!![/b] Please see pictures

This is a useful rundown of how this process works, for those who haven_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t bought from many auctions before: 1.
